meanings.definition: Lack of ability to express oneself clearly or fluently.
meanings.sent1: Her inarticulateness made it difficult for others to understand her.
meanings.sent2: The professor's inarticulateness during the lecture confused the students.
meanings.sent3: Despite his inarticulateness, he managed to convey his emotions through music.
meanings.sent4: The inarticulateness of the storm was evident in the howling winds and crashing waves.
meanings.sent5: The inarticulateness of the toddler's babbling was endearing to his parents.

meanings.definition: The state of being unable to communicate effectively through speech.
meanings.sent1: The child's inarticulateness was a source of frustration for his parents.
meanings.sent2: In moments of extreme emotion, her inarticulateness became more pronounced.
meanings.sent3: The comedian used his inarticulateness as a comedic device in his stand-up routine.
meanings.sent4: The inarticulateness of the situation left everyone speechless.
meanings.sent5: The inarticulateness of the radio transmission caused confusion among the listeners.
